intro: Baryosma oppositifolium, commonly known as the opposite-leaf baryosma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenia plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite leaf arrangement and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
